updateData.functionBody: return loginUrl;
return null;

if((!taskResults.loadMetaFileRecords)||(taskResults.loadMetaFileRecords.state != "SUCCESS")) return null;

return taskResults.loadMetaFileRecords.data.fileType;

community_entity.desc: This is a name used by the customer for the venue.

level.desc: This is the full name of the level. If it is longer than TBD characters a short name should also be added.
This is a short name for the level. It is used if the full name is longer than TBD characters.

ks.desc: This represents an area. There are alternate keys representing also representing specific types of areas.

baggage claim.desc: This is the area where baggage is retrieved. It should not be confused with a baggage carousel.

true.desc: This field represents a generic area.

ks.desc: This represents machinery, either fixed like a heater or portable like a computer.
This object represents the objects that construct a building. It can include physical objects like a wall or areas like a room.

bathroom.desc: A bathroom can have the gender property specified. Alternatively, the gender unspecified should represent both bathrooms. It can alternatively be used for the case of unisex bathroom in cases where the label unisex is obvious.

unisex.desc: This is for a bathroom for both genders.

family.desc: This is for an explicitly classified family bathroom.

ks.desc: This is appended to a bathroom when it is mapped as a room object instead of as a unit

doorway.desc: This is the open space in the wall where a door goes when plotted as an area. In the case of a line format wall, this doorway may be omitted if a door is present.

elevator bank.desc: This represents a collection of elevators. It can be used instead of drawing multiple elevators.

ks.desc: This flag can be added to the portion of a hallway that forms a vestibule.

hall area.desc: This is a large open area of hallway, not included intersections.

landing.desc: This is the area between stair flights. In some cases it can also be used for the area at the top or bottom of a stairway.

opening.desc: This is used to illustrate an entrance on objects without doorways, such as an escalator or ramp

patio.desc: This is an outdoor area, covered or uncovered, connected or disconnected with a building. This is closely related to a porch.

porch.desc: This is an covered outdoor area with a floor and typically open sides, connected to a building. This is closely related to a patio.

foyer.desc: This is an area at the entryway, often with access to other floors. It is closely related to a lobby but different.

lobby.desc: This is an area where the main information or clerk desk is located. It is closely related to a foyer but different.

stairs.desc: This represents a stairs object. It will typically be rendered with an icon.

stairwell.desc: This is the room that houses a stairway. It is typically rendered without an icon.

step.desc: This represents a single step on a stairway.

ks.desc: This represents a type of unit. As soon as entity categorization is fully used, this designation will be used only for units with a specific purpose. Several entries will be removed.

window opening.desc: This is the hole in the wall where a window goes.

element.desc: This is a generic building element object, like a wall or door (although they have their own classifications).

area.desc: This is a generic area in a building, simliar to a room or hallway.

detail.desc: This is a generic detail or contents layer object in a building, like a step.

ks.desc: This is a fixed object, or else one that is heavy and difficult to move.

baggage carousel.desc: This represents the baggae carousel fixture.

bin.desc: This represents a bin that is a fixture.

rack.desc: This represents a rack that is a fixture.

shelf.desc: This represents a shelf that is a fixture.

ks.desc: This represents a movable ojbect, like furniture.

bin.desc: This represents a bin that is a furnishing.

shelf.desc: This represents a shelf that is a furnishing.

ks.desc: This represents a marker. It can be either physical, like a traffic line, or nonphysical, like a text label.
This represents a meta data object. It is not a part of the map.
This is a safety or emergency response service or object.

true.desc: This is a generic safety object.

ks.desc: This is a service or amenity.
This represents a building or other structure.
This is intended for unmapped buildings only, if the level count is available.
This is intended for unmapped buildings only, if the level count is available.

subbuilding.desc: This represents a part of a building which will be treated as an independent building.

tent.desc: This is intended for durable tents.

ks.desc: This is used for one way roads. The direction refers to the direction relative to the direction the road path is drawn. Applicable to line and linear area roads only.

road intersection.desc: This is used at in intersection when area roads are drawn.

walkway intersection.desc: This is used at in intersection when area walkways are drawn.

geometry.desc: This is a textual description of the location, such as wold be given in a directory to help users find the object.
This is used to give an additional information on an object, such as the type of object when it is not included in the classification.

entity.desc: This field is used for storing geometry address information, before the geometry address is created. It should not be used for a descriptive location.

updateData.functionBody:
var oldPresetsCopy = apogee.util.deepJsonCopy(oldPresets);
return convert(oldPresetsCopy);

updateData.description:
This method creates a record given the field values and record info 
from the data set info. It creates and ID and uses standard permissions.

This creates a list of create instructions to go along with a list of records to be created.

There is the option to assign the ID or to leave it as undefined, in which case
an automatically incremented ID will be assigned. (For consistency in the data
set, either all records should be preassigned or all records should be 
automatically assigned.
This creates a body for a commit request, given a list of instructions and a commit message.
This creates the requestOptions, suitable for apogee.net.jsonRequest, to go with an type of request to the workingset (micemetarequest) server.
This function creates an update instruction given an initial and target record. If the records are the same then NULL is returned. (No update is needed.)

updateData.functionBody: return getRecordErrString(record) + " - " + fieldInfo.name;
return record.Type + " " + record.Id;

resource.html: Context:
